products.name: 15ml Wild Melaleuca
products.description:
Country of Origin: Australia, Wild Crafted

Botanical Name: Melaleuca quinquinervera

Plant Part: Leaf

Note: Sweet, Herbaceous, Menthol



Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: Similar to its cousin Tea Tree, but considered to be a more overall healer historically Melaleuca has been know to assist:

  • Decongestant: relieve congestion, coughs, infections, assist with allergies
  • Antibiotic: cleans wounds, kills parasites, kills fungal infections like ringworm and athlete’s foot
  • Whole Body Health: naturally treat acne, heal dandruff, fight off lice and bug bites, soothe inflamed skin


Extraction Method: Steam Distillation


Historic Benefits: Melaleuca has been used for thousands of years by the indigenous peoples of Australia to heal bacterial infections, fight fungi, and kill viruses.


Blends Well With: Cedarwood, Coriander, Cypress, Eucalyptus, Fennel, Juniper Berry, Lavender, Lemon, Lime, Myrtle, Peppermint, Pine, Ravintsara, Orange


Precautions: Do not use internally in extreme amounts.

Country of Origin: Somalia, Wild Crafted

Botanical Name: Commiphora myrrha

Plant Part: Resin

Note: Woody and Earthy


Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: For greater details, see the picture printout from my book. Historically Myrrh has been used to assist in:

  • Immune system: boots, Inhibits growth of multiple types of cancer cells
  • Skin: soothes, repairs, reduces inflammation
  • Liver: stimulates, protects
  • Digestion: fights parasites and bacteria in the digestive tract
  • Respiratory: relax the respiratory system
  • General Tonic: treat wounds, prevents infections, detoxifier


Extraction Method: Hydro-Distilled


Historic Benefits: Mentioned in the bible 152 times, Myrrh was important in biblical times. It was used as a natural healing remedy, spice, and to purify the dead. Traditionally used in religious ceremonies for thousands of years. It is commonly remembered as one of the three precious gifts brought to the baby Jesus.


Blends Well With: Bergamot, Clove, Cypress, Frankincense, Lavender, Patchouli, Sandalwood


Precautions: Avoid during pregnancy.

products.name: 15ml Peppermint, First Distilled
products.description:
Country of Origin: USA, First Distilled Ethically Cultivated

Botanical Name: Mentha piperita

Plant Part: Leaf and Plant

Note: Minty with Herby Undertones



Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: Peppermint is normally distilled at a high temperature and pressure to extract the most oil from the plant. This type of extraction will create a nice sharp candy cane like fragrance but lower overall therapeutic value. True therapeutic Peppermint has a herby smell to it because it is distilled at low temperature and pressure so the other beneficial healing properties are not burned off. For greater details, see the picture printout from my book. Historically Peppermint has been used to assist in:

  • Respiratory System: colds, coughs, fevers, throat infections, asthma, bronchitis, decongestant, expectorant
  • Pain: muscle, joint, inflammation, spasms, increases the circulation to the area applied
  • Nervous System: mental alertness, fatigue, headaches, vertigo, stress, uplifting
  • Digestive: colic, gas, nausea, diarrhea, indigestion, heartburn, food poisoning
  • Skin: acne, dermatitis, itchy skin, sunburns, scabies


Extraction Method: Steam Distillation 


Historic Benefits: Used in flavoring, digestive aid, and pest repellent.


Blends Well With: Basil, Bergamot, Black Pepper, Cajeput, Cedarwood, Cinnamon Bark, Citrus, Cypress, Eucalyptus, Geranium, Ginger, Ravintsara, Juniper Berry, Lavender, Marjoram, Pine, Rosemary, Spearmint, Tea Tree, Thyme, Wintergreen 


Precautions: Can be a hotter oil on sensitive individuals or children. Dilute when necessary.

Grapefruit is a powerful antioxidant, disinfectant, and antidepressant.
